name.title: Name
name.description: Enter term(s) to be found within the title or name of the Person or Group. "AND", "OR", and "-" do not have special meaning in Advanced Search as they do in Simple Search. Instead use multiple fields connected with "have All of", "have Any of", and "have None of" respectively.

text.title: Anywhere
text.description: Search for People & Groups by terms anywhere in the record. "AND", "OR", and "-" do not have special meaning in Advanced Search as they do in Simple Search. Instead use multiple fields connected with "have All of", "have Any of", and "have None of" respectively.

startAt.title: Born/Formed At
startAt.description: Search for People & Groups that were born or formed in the specified Place.

startDate.title: Born/Formed Date
startDate.description: Search People & Groups by the date on which they were born or formed.

carriedOut.title: Carried Out
carriedOut.description: Search for People & Groups that carried out the specified Event.

classification.description: Search for People & Groups that are categorized with the specified Concept or Type terms.

produced.title: Created Object
produced.description: Search for People & Groups that created the specified Objects.

created.title: Created Works
created.description: Search for People & Groups that authored or created the specified Works.

curated.title: Curated
curated.description: Search for Groups responsible for the curation of Yale's collections.

endAt.title: Died/Dissolved At
endAt.description: Search for People & Groups that died or were dissolved in the specified Place.

endDate.title: Died/Dissolved Date

encountered.title: Encountered
encountered.description: Search for People & Groups that encountered or found the specified Objects.

foundedBy.title: Founded By
foundedBy.description: Search for Groups by the specified People that were responsible for their foundation.

founded.title: Founded Group
founded.description: Search for People who were responsible for the foundation of the specified Groups.

gender.title: Gender
gender.description: Search for People by the specified Gender. This information comes from external sources, and gender information may not match expected results.

hasDigitalImage.title: Have Digital Image
hasDigitalImage.description: Search for People & Groups for which digital images are available.

memberOfInverse.title: Have Member
memberOfInverse.description: Search for Groups that have the specified People & Groups as members.

id.title: ID
id.description: Search for People & Groups by their LUX data URI (e.g. starting with https://lux.collections.yale.edu/data/ and followed by a URI path containing a UUID, not the URI with /view/ in it).

identifier.title: Identifier
identifier.description: Search for People & Groups by a string identifier or an external authority URI, such as ULAN, VIAF or wikidata.

influencedCreation.title: Influenced Creation Of Works

occupation.title: Occupation/Role
occupation.description: Search for People & Groups with the specified Occupation or Role.

recordType.title: Person or Group Class
recordType.description: Search for records categorized as either a "Person" or a "Group". Person is an individual either real or fictionalized. Group is an organization, either real or fictionalized, with one or more members.

professionalActivity.description: Search for people and groups that carried out professional activities of the given categorization.

published.title: Published

subjectOfAgent.description: Search for People & Groups that are the subject of the specified Works.

recordType.title: Concept Class
recordType.description: Search for records categorized as either a "Measurement Unit", "Language", "Material", "Currency" or a "General Concept". Measurement Units are Concepts that are used as the unit of a measurement, such as inches, seconds, kilograms or bytes. Languages are Concepts that represent human-spoken languages, such as English, Spanish or Latin. Materials are Concepts that represent a class of physical material, such as bronze, paper, or agate. Currencies are Concepts that represent monetary currencies, such as dollars, euros, or francs. General Concepts are Concepts that represent more general ideas or subjects, which excludes the more specific classes of Measurement Unit, Language, Material, and Currency.

genderOf.title: Gender of
genderOf.description: Search for Concept terms that describe the Gender of the specified People & Groups. This information comes from external sources, and gender information may not match expected results.

hasDigitalImage.title: Have Digital Image
hasDigitalImage.description: Search for Concept and Type terms for which digital images are available.

id.title: ID
id.description: Search for Concept or Type terms by their LUX data URI (e.g. starting with https://lux.collections.yale.edu/data/ and followed by a URI path containing a UUID, not the URI with /view/ in it).

text.description: Search for Events by terms anywhere in the record. "AND", "OR", and "-" do not have special meaning in Advanced Search as they do in Simple Search. Instead use multiple fields connected with "have All of", "have Any of", and "have None of" respectively.

endDate.description: Search for Events by the date on which they ended.

recordType.title: Event Class
recordType.description: Search for records categorized as either a "Period" or an "Activity". Periods are Events that have the class of Period, which consists of a Time Period, as opposed to other human-caused activities. Activities are Events that have the class of Activity, which consists of events such as Exhibitions or other collections-related activities.

id.title: ID
id.description: Search for Events by their LUX data URI (e.g. starting with https://lux.collections.yale.edu/data/ and followed by a URI path containing a UUID, not the URI with /view/ in it).

dimension.title: Dimension: Any
dimension.description: Search for Objects by selecting a comparison operator and entering a value to be compared against each of the object's dimensions. The unit is centimeters.

depth.title: Dimension: Depth
depth.description: Search for Objects by selecting a comparison operator and entering a value to be compared against the object's depth dimension. The unit is centimeters.

height.title: Dimension: Height
height.description: Search for Objects by selecting a comparison operator and entering a value to be compared against the object's height dimension. The unit is centimeters.

width.title: Dimension: Width
width.description: Search for Objects by selecting a comparison operator and entering a value to be compared against the object's width dimension. The unit is centimeters.

encounteredAt.title: Encountered At
encounteredAt.description: Search for Objects that were encountered or found at the specified Place. This is primarily used for Specimens.

encounteredBy.title: Encountered By
encounteredBy.description: Search for Objects that were encountered or found by the specified People & Groups. This is primarily used for Specimens.

encounteredDate.title: Encountered Date

hasDigitalImage.title: Have Digital Image
hasDigitalImage.description: Search for Objects for which digital images are available.

id.title: ID
id.description: Search for Objects by their LUX data URI (e.g. starting with https://lux.collections.yale.edu/data/ and followed by a URI path containing a UUID, not the URI with /view/ in it).

identifier.title: Identifier
identifier.description: Search for Objects by a string identifier or an external authority URI, such as LCSH, BNF or wikidata.

carries.title: Include Works
carries.description: Search for Objects that include the specified Works. Use this option to include additional criteria from Works records in your search.

material.title: Material
material.description: Search for Objects that are made of the specified Material (used primarily for art works).

memberOf.title: Member of
memberOf.description: Search for Objects that are members of the specified Collection, Exhibition or Archive.

recordType.title: Object Class
recordType.description: Search for records categorized as either a "Physical Object" or a "Digital Object". Physical Objects are physical items, such as paintings, sculptures, fossils and other specimens, and archival objects. Individual physical copies of books are included in this class. Digital Object are digital items, such as internet resources (datasets, e-books, and other digital files). Digitized images of collection items that are physical objects can be found with the “Is Online” facet on Physical Objects.

subjectOfItem.title: Subject Of
subjectOfItem.description: Search for Objects that are the subject of the specified Works.

text.description: Search for Works by terms anywhere in the record. "AND", "OR", and "-" do not have special meaning in Advanced Search as they do in Simple Search. Instead use multiple fields connected with "have All of", "have Any of", and "have None of" respectively.

isOnline.title: Are Online
isOnline.description: Search for Works with Online Versions.

isPublicDomain.title: Are in the Public Domain
isPublicDomain.description: Search for Works that have been identified as public domain/no copyright materials. Note that this only applies to materials from the Yale University Art Gallery and Yale Center for British Art collections at this time. For copyright questions or more information about rights and re-use of content found in LUX, please contact the appropriate museum or library or consult the Rights and Usage Frequently Asked Questions(Advanced Search Help) linked below.

classification.title: Categorized As
classification.description: Search for Works that are categorized with the specified Concept or Type terms.

containsWork.title: Contains Works
containsWork.description: Search for Works that contain the specified Works.

createdAt.title: Created At
createdAt.description: Search for Works that were created at the specified Places.

createdBy.title: Created By
createdBy.description: Search for Works that were authored or created by the specified People & Groups.

createdDate.title: Created Date
createdDate.description: Search for Works by the date on which they were authored or created. Note the difference with Publication Date.

creationCausedBy.title: Creation Caused By
creationCausedBy.description: Search for Works that were created because of the specified Events.

creationInfluencedBy.title: Creation Influenced By
creationInfluencedBy.description: Search for Works that were created with influence by the specified Person or Group

hasDigitalImage.title: Have Digital Image
hasDigitalImage.description: Search for Works for which digital images are available.

id.title: ID
id.description: Search for Works by their LUX data URI (e.g. starting with https://lux.collections.yale.edu/data/ and followed by a URI path containing a UUID, not the URI with /view/ in it).

identifier.title: Identifier
identifier.description: Search for Works by a string identifier, such as a call number, or an external authority URI, such as BNF, DNB or wikidata.

carriedBy.title: Included In Objects
carriedBy.description: Search for Works that are included in the specified Objects. Use this option to include criteria from Objects in your search.

language.title: Language
language.description: Search for Works in the specified Language.

partOfWork.title: Part Of Works
partOfWork.description: Search for Works that are part of the specified Works.

publishedAt.title: Published At
publishedAt.description: Search for Works that were published by the specified People & Groups. Note the difference with Creation Place, which is where the text was originally created.

publishedBy.title: Published By
publishedBy.description: Search for Works that were published by the specified People & Groups. Note the difference with Creation People & Groups that originally wrote the text or conceived the work.

publishedDate.title: Published Date
publishedDate.description: Search for Works by the date on which they were published. Note the difference with Creation Date, which is when the work was originally conceived by its creator.

subjectOfWork.title: Subject Of
subjectOfWork.description: Search for Works that are the subject of the specified Works.

recordType.title: Work Class
recordType.description: Search for records categorized as either a "Visual Work" or a "Textual Work. Visual Works are Works that are primarily visual, such as the images shown by paintings or photographs, sculptures, or other non language oriented creative expressions. Textual Works are Works that are primarily textual or otherwise convey information via human language. An Object may include both visual and textual works, such as a poster with graphics and text. In addition, Textual Works encompasses most items from the Library collections, including posters, artworks, musical scores, video and sound recordings.
